author: Special Correspondent
text:
The free bus rides for senior citizens announced by Chief Minister Jayalalithaa in the Assembly last week was implemented by the Metropolitan Transport Corporation on Wednesday.

Under this scheme, senior citizens can download the application forms from www.mtcbus.org or from bus depots or bus terminuses and get identity cards and tokens. “As of now, 10 tokens for each month from February to May are being given,” an official release said, adding that each token has a validity of one month only. So far, identity cards have been issued to about 22,500 persons under this scheme. Documents to prove the age and residence of the applicant should be attached along with two passport-size photographs while applying.

“The scheme for free bus travel for senior citizens can be used on all buses of the Metropolitan Transport Corporation, except air-conditioned buses,” the release said.

title: Free bus ride scheme implemented by MTC
